skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
Souls retrieved from the Netherwold and bound to their controller provide a degree of magical resistance.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +10% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +30% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: This one was among the first to discover the secrets--and sacrifices--of eternal life.
Countless loyal Nehekharans lie beneath the sands ready to rise and serve their great kings.
To bargain with the God of the Underworld carries a substantial cost. To seek ultimate power, one must sacrifice much.

effects.description:
Cooldown: 0% to all spells
	(all characters factionwide)

Cooldown: -1% to all spells
	(all characters factionwide)

Cooldown: -2% to all spells
	(all characters factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: By which the dead don't stay that way for long, springing back into jerking, clanking Unlife.
Every syllable strips moisture and saps vitality from the bodies of Usekhp's unfortunate victims.

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.

skillTree.localised_description: "The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening."

skillTree.localised_description: Simple stone is afforded more respect than other materials, for from its grain giant guardians are hewn, brought to shuddering life by the Liche Priests' sorcery.

skillTree.localised_description: Not even stone is set in stone it seems â€“ arcane death magic is used to bring tortured, savage vigour to once-dormant stone sentinels.

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Arrows loosed under the ever-watchful eye of the Serpent Goddess find their marks with divine precision.

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The very strength of the desert, to stand sentinel over the Tomb Kings' domain and crush their enemies to dust.

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local region)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
"Revered One, Venerable One, Lord of Secrets, High Priest of the Temple of Yearsâ€¦"

effects.description:
Spell resistance: 10% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The people of the desert live and die by their oaths in Basth's graceful sight.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 5% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The God of the Scorpions protects the venal, the perfidious, and the downright murderous.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +10%
	(own characters in province)

Melee attack: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(all units in army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Tomb Kings and their servants feel Khsar's wrath coursing through their Unliving veins.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Unlife is forever; it is therefore prudent to go willingly and prepared.
Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.

effects.description:
Armour: +5 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Vulture-God assists the desert poozler, lest they lose their way 'neath the scorching desert sun.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
